title: Bot lane bullies don't feel like they fall off.
body:
Edit: I may have chosen poor examples of lane bullies. That's my bad. 

Just something I've been thinking about. Lane bullies are powerful early game champions that have a weaker late game to compensate them (best example is Pantheon, who falls off after 30 minutes). These are meant to counter hypercarries by prolonging their power spikes. 

Now every lane has bullies. Top has Pantheon, Darius, and Riven (I consider her a bully, but I could be wrong). Mid has Zed. Bot has Lucian, Miss Fortune, and Draven (and others I'm sure). 

So I have to ask, when do bot lane bullies fall off?  Draven I kinda understand because he's built around a positioning minigame that seperates good Dravens from bad pretty easily. But I've never felt like Lucian (even when playing him if I get fed. He's one of my favorite ADCs because he encourages spell weaving) or MF really fall off as the game goes on. 

Am I the only one who thinks this?

Honestly, Draven doesn't fall off. >Draven Main<
I go a mixed armor pen, especially touching on that LANE BULLY thing you're talking about.
I use flat armor pen mark runes, and have like 11 flat going into lane, with 7% from masteries.  Then, serrated dirk into Ghostblade, means I have 20 flat armor pen in the first 11 minutes of the game, which makes one shotting people until I get my last whisper item still pretty easy.

Ghostblade > Phantom Dancer > Bloodthirster > Infinity Edge > Last Whisper item (throw berserker's greaves in there after first item or some shit idk) and I crit enemy carries (mid laner, adc, squishy junglers?) for like 1100 late game with my axe crits. Teamfights at that point especially in my elo, mainly depend on how well my team can keep me alive so I can dump on nerds as much as possible.
I'll give it to you, Draven never truly falls off unless he's built to fall off. (Going into a straight armor pen build with duskblade and youmuu's rather than grabbing any crit and % armor pen)

gotta take advantage of her mid game power drop before she hits her late game power

She's always been good early and late game. Shes just picked more so now you notice it. She has a weak Mid game that you can take advantage of, as long as you haven't fed her like crazy early, because that can make her skip over the entire weak point

Marksmen are required to be decent late game. That's just part of how critical strikes work, along with perfect reliability (their auto attacks are their main source of damage, and auto attacks have no counterplay).

To differentiate, some marksmen are very good in the early game. They may do less damage than their counterparts in the late game, but the difference between 700 damage per auto attack and 500 damage per auto attack  isn't much in the middle of a chaotic team fight.

What are your thoughts on Caitlyn? A lot of people complain about her but i honestly dont see her as a problem.
Caitlyn is strong early and also very strong lategame where AA range has tremendous value, but she is weaker than most other ADCs in the midgame.

The question is, is the dip in mid-game pronounced enough to compensate for the lead she can build in early? Does it provide a significant window where you can act pro-actively, as her opponent, even if she is slightly ahead?

(Real question, not trying to imply it is or isn't the case.)

Her solo Q winrates are very middle of the pack as far as ADCs go, and although she is played reasonably often in competitive it's definitely not an oppressive amount that she crowds out other ADCs. So yes, I think Caitlyn's weaknesses in the midgame are enough to counterbalance her strong early and late game.

adc are only ever banned if one of them is strong enough to be noticably overpowered to the point where he can solo carry games.

I think the only ADC that falls off significantly at this point is {{champion:429}} . And her early game isn't that great either, and it's very support dependent.

Before I say anything else Zed isn't a lane bully.

Now the thing is gold income hasn't changed that much to compensate the earlier late game. So champions who are getting fed and then dragging it onto the new standard time for late game aren't falling off because they are actually still ahead power-wise. They got ahead early somehow, and are staying ahead, and you aren't reaching your late game power spikes cause you actually require a lot of different stats to be powerful. Mean while people like Lucian, Graves, Draven, even a few crit-ADCs like Jinx, need one or two items to be powerful. So I guess if there is anything to change, it would be how dominant these laners are.
